thread.title: Cristiano Ronaldo netted 48 goals in 35 league games
thread.title_full: Cristiano Ronaldo netted 48 goals in 35 league games

title: Cristiano Ronaldo netted 48 goals in 35 league games
text:
Cristiano Ronaldo netted 48 goals in 35 league games 
  
Real Madrid superstar Cristiano Ronaldo has been presented with the Golden Boot award for the 2014-15 season, which celebrates the leading goalscorer throughout Europe during the term.The Portuguese forward netted 48 goals in 35 La Liga matches last season, but Los Blancos still played second-fiddle to a dominant Barcelona, which won not only the title, but also the UEFA Champions League and the Spanish Cup. In a ceremony held in a hotel in the center of the Spanish capital—and also attended by his coach, Rafael Benitez, and club president Florentino Perez—Ronaldo said it was an honor and a privilege to receive his fourth Golden Boot. Ronaldo has got off to a relatively sluggish start to this campaign. A striking stat shows that although he has scored five goals in seven league appearances to date, they all came in that same 6-0 win at Espanyol in September.But two Champions League goals in a recent game in Malmo saw him overtake Raul Gonzalez as the club's all-time top goal-scorer, and he now has scored 324 times for the club. Ronaldo says that winning trophies is key to collecting these individual awards."I'm the only one who has four Golden Boots, but I want more, the fifth, the sixth, if I can. Obviously, that means winning things as a group, as a team, trophies," Ronaldo said."For me, Real Madrid is the biggest club in the world and it has to win titles every year. Obviously, this year won't be any different. We have the opportunity and we want to win the league, the Champions League if possible, the cup, obviously, because without those trophies these individual trophies aren't possible." Related Videos
